com.stoyanr.mastermind

Class Mastermind

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stoyanr.mastermind.Mastermind

  • public class Mastermind
extends Object
    A particular Mastermind game setup. The game setup is generalized to cover "Mastermind", "Bulls and Cows", and all their variants one can imagine by introducing the following game parameters:
    • The alphabet of possible code characters.
    • The length of the combination.
    • Whether the characters of the combination must be unique or not (uniqueChars).

    For "Mastermind" and "Bulls and Cows" these parameters have the following values:

    Game alphabet length uniqueChars
    Mastermind ABCDEF 4 false
    Bulls and Cows 0123456789 4 true

    These three parameters are initialized upon construction and used to calculate other parameters of the game setup, such as all valid codes and scores (or "answers"). This class also provides methods for determining code and score validity, for evaluating how a given guess scores against a given code, for visiting all valid codes, and others.

    Author:
    Stoyan Rachev

    • Constructor Detail

      • Mastermind

        public Mastermind(String alphabet,
          int length,
          boolean uniqueChars)
        Creates a new Mastermind game setup with the specified alphabet, length, and character uniqueness.
        Parameters:
        alphabet - The alphabet of possible code characters, should contain unique characters from the set "0123456789ABCDEFGH". The length of the alphabet should be greater or equal to the length parameter.
        length - The combination length, an integer number in the range [1, 9].
        uniqueChars - Whether the characters of the combination must be unique or not.

    • Method Detail

      • getAllPossibleScores

        public final List<Score> getAllPossibleScores()
        Returns a list containing all possible scores (or answers) for the current game setup. This list has been previously evaluated upon construction. For example, for the setup [AB, 2, false], the list of possible scores is [(2,0), (0,2)]
        Returns:
        All possible scores for the current game setup.

      • getAllPossibleCodes

        public final SortedSet<String> getAllPossibleCodes()
        Returns a set containing all possible (valid) codes for the current game setup. This set has been previously evaluated upon construction. For example, for the setup [AB, 2, false], the set of possible codes is [AB, BA]
        Returns:
        All possible (valid) codes for the current game setup, sorted alphabetically.

      • isValidCode

        public final boolean isValidCode(String code)
        Determines if the passed code is valid for the current game setup. A code is considered valid if it is not null, is of the correct length, and contains only characters from the alphabet. The character uniqueness is also taken into account. For example, for the setup [AB, 2, false], the only valid codes are AB and BA.
        Returns:
        true if the passed code is valid, false otherwise.

      • isValidScore

        public final boolean isValidScore(Score score)
        Determines if the passed score is valid for the current game setup. A score is considered valid if it can be found in the previously evaluated set of all possible scores. For example, for the setup [AB, 2, false], the only valid scores are (2,0) and (0,2).
        Returns:
        true if the passed score is valid, false otherwise.

      • generateCode

        public final String generateCode()
        Generates a random valid code for the current game setup.
        Returns:
        A random code for the current game setup.

      • getWinningScore

        public final Score getWinningScore()
        Returns the winning score for the current game setup, that is a score with 0 cows and length bulls. For example, for the setup [AB, 2, false], the winning score is (0,2).
        Returns:
        The winning score for the current game setup.

      • evaluateScoreSafe

        public final Score evaluateScoreSafe(String guess,
                      String code)
        Evaluates how the passed guess scores against the passed code in the current game setup. Throws an exception if either the guess or the code are not valid codes for the current game setup. For example, for the setup [AB, 2, false], BA scores against AB as (2,0), while AB scores against AB as (0,2).
        Parameters:
        guess - The guess to be checked.
        code - The code against which the guess should be checked.
        Returns:
        The score of the guess against the code.
        Throws:
        MastermindException - If either the guess or the code are not valid codes for the current game setup.
        See Also:
        evaluateScore(String, String)

      • evaluateScore

        public final Score evaluateScore(String guess,
                  String code)
        Evaluates how the passed guess scores against the passed code in the current game setup. Assumes that both the guess and the code are valid codes for the current game setup. For example, for the setup [AB, 2, false], BA scores against AB as (2,0), while AB scores against AB as (0,2).
        Parameters:
        guess - The guess to be checked.
        code - The code against which the guess should be checked.
        Returns:
        The score of the guess against the code.
        See Also:
        evaluateScoreSafe(String, String)

      • evaluatePossibleCodes

        public final SortedSet<String> evaluatePossibleCodes(String guess,
                                      Score score,
                                      SortedSet<String> codes)
        Determines all codes from the passed codes against which the passed guess evaluates as the passed score. Assumes that both the guess and the score are valid for the current game setup. For example, for the setup [AB, 2, false], for the guess BA, the score (2,0) and the set of all possible codes, the returned set will contain only AB.
        Parameters:
        guess - The guess to be checked.
        score - The score that we are aiming at.
        codes - The codes against which the guess should be checked.
        Returns:
        All codes which satisfy the above conditions, sorted alphabetically.

      • visitCodes

        public final void visitCodes(CodeVisitor visitor)
        Visits all valid codes for the current game setup. These codes are passed to the visit() method of the passed visitor.
        Parameters:
        visitor - The visitor.
